item.title: Mediator in Kotlin
item.description: Purpose We define a Mediator as an object encapsulating interactions between other objects (components) from a given set. The pattern limits, or even cuts off completely, direct dependencies between classes. Components can only communicate with each other through the Mediator, which becomes the central hub for information and control. The Mediator controls the flow of information using its internal logic. This can be compared to the air traffic control tower (ATC).
